citations.narrative:
The facility is not protecting animals from injury. The metal fencing of the outdoor enclosure that is housing adult goats is
in a state of disrepair. The metal wires have broken off creating sharp points that are accessible to the animals. Sharp
points can cause injury and distress to the regulated animals. The facility must be constructed of such material and of
such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound
and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. Corrected at the time
of inspection.

The feed troughs for the adult goats are not being kept in sanitary conditions. A brown crusty pellet residue was seen
adhered to the bottom of the feed troughs. Additionally, bird droppings were also seen on the edges of the feed troughs.
Improperly cleaned food receptacles can cause contamination of food, which may have a negative impact on the health
and well-being of the animals. Correct by ensuring food receptacles are kept clean and sanitary at all times. Correct by
15-SEP-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The facility is not protecting animals from injury. The metal fencing of the outdoor enclosure that is housing adult goats is 
in a state of disrepair. The metal wires have broken off creating sharp points that are accessible to the animals. Sharp 
points can cause injury and distress to the regulated animals. The facility must be constructed of such material and of 
such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound 
and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. Corrected at the time 
of inspection. 
3.129(b) 
   
Feeding. 
The feed troughs for the adult goats are not being kept in sanitary conditions. A brown crusty pellet residue was seen 
adhered to the bottom of the feed troughs. Additionally, bird droppings were also seen on the edges of the feed troughs. 
Improperly cleaned food receptacles can cause contamination of food, which may have a negative impact on the health 
and well-being of the animals. Correct by ensuring food receptacles are kept clean and sanitary at all times. Correct by 
15-SEP-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
